Speculum Romanae Magnificentiae. Omnia fere quaecunq(ue) in urbe monumenta extant, partim iuxta antiquam, partim iuxta hodiernam formam accuratiss(ime) delineata repraesentans. Accesserunt non paucae, tum antiquarum, tum modernarum rerum. Urbis figurae nunquam antehac aeditae.

A Mirror of Roman Magnificence - Representing nearly all the monuments in the city, however small, some ancient in form, some modern, most accurately sketched - The images of the city, never displayed before now, constitute not a small number of ancient and modern subjects.
Roma tenet propriis monumenta sepulta ruinis plurima, quae profert hic rediviva liber. Hunc igitur lector scrutare benigni, docebit urbis maiestas pristina quanta fuit.

Rome retains many monuments buried in their own ruins, which this book publishes restored. Therefore most benevolent reader, examine closely this book, it will show how great was the former grandeur of the city.
Antonio Lafreri published it in Rome
